scheduling

Class Activity

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduling.Activity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Activity>

    public class Activity
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Activity>
    Activity in a Block within a Schedule
    Author:
    Joffrey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int activityId
      id of the activity, beware, it is here an absolute number of the activity.
      private Block block
      Associated block
      private int end
      end, in minutes between 0 and 24*60-1.
      private ActivityEvent event
      Event linked to this activity, when the time comes to do that activity, the event is called
      private int start
      start, in minutes between 0 and 24*60-1.
      private static int staticActivityId
      static counter used to set an activity's id
      private ActivityStatus status
      status of the activity, see the ActivityStatus class
      private ActivityType type
      type of the activity, see the ActivityType class

      boolean canBeDone() 
      Activity clone()
      deep copy of this activity, the layer of schedule under the activity (ActivityEvent) is also clones linked to the newly created clone activity.
      int compareTo(Activity act)
      TODO take into account the week and day, even though comparison are made within the same day Compares two activities, so that Activity implements Comparable correctly if this starts earliers than the act input then it returns -1 else if this starts on the same minute as act then it returns 0 else if this starts after act input then it return 1
      void delete()
      Only an activity which does not have a status free can be deleted

    • Field Detail

      • block

        private Block block
        Associated block

      • activityId

        private int activityId
        id of the activity, beware, it is here an absolute number of the activity. Not the number of the activity in the associated block. All the activities in the program have an id which represents the order of creation. Hence the activityId is between 0 and +infinity.

      • start

        private int start
        start, in minutes between 0 and 24*60-1.

      • end

        private int end
        end, in minutes between 0 and 24*60-1.

      • type

        private ActivityType type
        type of the activity, see the ActivityType class

      • status

        private ActivityStatus status
        status of the activity, see the ActivityStatus class

      • event

        private ActivityEvent event
        Event linked to this activity, when the time comes to do that activity, the event is called

      • staticActivityId

        private static int staticActivityId
        static counter used to set an activity's id

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Activity clone()
        deep copy of this activity, the layer of schedule under the activity (ActivityEvent) is also clones linked to the newly created clone activity. The clone activity is however linked to the same block as the original activity.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • insert

        public boolean insert(Activity activity)
        Should normally be used if this is a free activity
        Parameters:
        activity -
        Returns:
        true if this in which we insert has been completely replaced by the activity

      • isCurrent

        public boolean isCurrent()

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Only an activity which does not have a status free can be deleted

      • merge

        private void merge(Activity activity)
        this must always be before activity both this and activity must be free activity
        Parameters:
        activity -

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Activity act)
        TODO take into account the week and day, even though comparison are made within the same day Compares two activities, so that Activity implements Comparable correctly if this starts earliers than the act input then it returns -1 else if this starts on the same minute as act then it returns 0 else if this starts after act input then it return 1
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Activity>
